title: TON price prediction 2025-2031: Will TON reach $100?
body: Key takeaways: Our TON price prediction anticipates a high of $6.35 in 2025. In 2027, it will range between $9.26 and $11.49, with an average price of $9.60. In 2030, it will range between $28.31 and $34.81, with an average price of $29.16. TON (The Open Network) is a decentralized protocol designed by Telegram and created by the community. The protocol is a distributed supercomputer, or “super server,” that consists of TON Blockchain , TON DNS, TON Storage, and TON Sites. The native token for the TON ecosystem is called Toncoin. “Will TON ever go up? Can TON reach the $10 mark? Where will TON be in five years?” These are the questions traders and investors ask. Let’s answer them and more in our Toncoin price prediction. Overview Cryptocurrency Toncoin Symbol TON Current price $3.29 Toncoin market cap $8.13B Trading volume $293.36M Circulating supply 2.47B All-time high $8.24 on Jun 15, 2024 All-time low $0.3906 on Sep 20, 2021 24-hour high $3.37 24-hour low $3.23 TON price prediction: Technical analysis Metric Value Volatility (30-day variation) 4.94% 50-day SMA $3.01 200-day SMA $3.71 Sentiment Neutral Green days 19/30 (63%) Fear and Greed Index 71 (Greed) Toncoin price analysis On July 21, TON’s price dropped by 0.68% in 24 hours. Over the last 30 days, it rose by 12.59%. The TON price steadily declined after reaching the local high of $6 in early December 2024. In March 2025, it dropped beneath the $2.5 mark for the first time in over a year. It recovered last month and reached a high of $3.50. This month, it dropped to $3.0. Looking at its DeFi ecosystem, TON’s Total Value Locked (TVL) rose by 2.36% in the last 24 hours to $157M. TON/USD 1-day chart price analysis TONUSD chart by TradingView Toncoin remained bullish from last week with rising volatility. Its relative strength index is at 69.97; it is overbought when it rises above 70. The trend is confirmed with positive histograms and bullish candles. TON/USD 4-hour chart price analysis TONUSD chart by TradingView The 4-hour chart shows that TON has remained bullish this month. The William Alligator trendlines show that its volatility is rising. TON technical indicators: Levels and action Daily simple moving average (SMA) Period Value ($) Action SMA 3 3.17 BUY SMA 5 3.30 BUY SMA 10 3.26 BUY SMA 21 3.01 BUY SMA 50 3.01 BUY SMA 100 3.09 BUY SMA 200 3.71 SELL Daily exponential moving average (EMA) Period Value ($) Action EMA 3 3.00 BUY EMA 5 3.00 BUY EMA 10 3.06 BUY EMA 21 3.19 BUY EMA 50 3.40 SELL EMA 100 3.82 SELL EMA 200 4.39 SELL What to expect from TON price analysis next? Our chart analysis indicates a bullish sentiment confirmed by positive market momentum. The coin now faces resistance at $3.40. With rising volatility, a sharp reversal is probable. Why is TON up? The rise in TON value could be attributed to the recovery in the crypto market, as well as TonBit’s discovery and patching of a TON Virtual Machine bug on July 21 (TonBit), preventing potential network crashes and DApp disruptions. This maintained trust in Telegram’s ecosystem. Recent news Telegram’s deal with xAI, which would see Elon Musk’s AI company integrate into Telegram, is a work in progress despite an announcement from Pavel Durov. While Durov confirmed that the deal is yet to be signed, the Telegram founder said there is an “agreement in principle.” Is TON a good buy? According to Cryptopolitan price predictions, TON will trade higher in the years to come. However, factors like market crashes or difficult regulations could invalidate this bullish theory. Will TON reach $10? Yes, TON should rise above $10 in 2027. The move will come as the market recovers to previous highs. Will TON reach $100? Per the Cryptopolitan price prediction, TON is unlikely to reach $100 before 2031. Will TON reach $1,000? Per the Cryptopolitan price prediction, TON is unlikely to reach $1000 before 2031. Does Toncoin have a future? TON has had a bullish run since its inception despite seasonal market corrections. The TON blockchain has a vibrant community of users and developers. Looking ahead, Toncoin has the potential to trade higher in the coming years. How much will a Toncoin be worth in 2030? The TON price prediction for 2030 indicates the price will range between $28.31 and $34.81. The average price of Toncoin will be $29.16. TON price prediction July 2025 The TON July price prediction ranges from $2.44 to $3.50. It will average at $2.73. Period Potential low ($) Potential average ($) Potential high ($) July 2.44 2.73 3.50 TON price prediction 2025 As 2025 unfolds, TON remains bullish, as evidenced by the price registering higher highs. The price will range between $2.02 and $6.35. The average price for the month will be $4.23. Year Potential low ($) Potential average ($) Potential high ($) 2025 2.02 4.23 6.35 TON price prediction 2026 – 2031 Year Potential low ($) Potential average ($) Potential high ($) 2026 6.58000 6.80000 7.71000 2027 9.26000 9.60000 11.49000 2028 13.84000 14.22000 16.29000 2029 20.71000 21.27000 23.42000 2030 28.31000 29.16000 34.81000 2031 41.21000 42.37000 48.12000 TON price prediction 2026 The year 2026 will experience more bullish momentum. According to the TON price prediction, it will range between $6.58 and $7.71, with an average trading price of $6.80. TON price prediction 2027 The TON token prediction climbs even higher into 2027. According to the prediction, Toncoin’s price will range between $9.26 and $11.49, with an average price of $9.60. TON price prediction 2028 The analysis suggests a further acceleration in TON’s price. TON will trade between $13.84 and $16.29. It will average at $14.22. TON price prediction 2029 According to the TON price prediction for 2029, the price of TON will range between a minimum of $20.71, a maximum of $23.42, and an average of $21.27. TON price prediction 2025 – 2031 TON market price prediction: Analysts’ TON price forecast Platform 2025 2026 2027 Digitalcoinprice $7.30 $9.27 $12.65 Coincodex $9.78 $6.57 $3.84 Gate.io $3.73 $4.32 $4.60 Cryptopolitan TON price prediction Our predictions show TON will achieve a high of $6.35 in 2025. In 2027, it will range between $9.26 and $11.49, with an average of $9.60. In 2030, it will range between $28.31 and $34.81, with an average of $29.16. Note that the predictions are not investment advice. Seek independent professional consultation or do your research. TON historic price sentiment Ton price by CoinGecko Ton network launched in 2018 as the Telegram Open Network (TON) but was later renamed “The Open Network” and taken over by the TON Foundation. In June 2020, all Toncoin tokens (98.55% of the total supply) became available for mining. The tokens were placed in special Giver smart contracts, enabling anyone to mine until 28 June 2022. Users mined around 200,000 TON daily. All the tokens were mined in two years, marking the completion of the distribution event. On September 20, 2021, TON registered its all-time low price at $0.3906. Its first significant break came in November 2021. In days, the coin slid from $0.8 to $4.5. It corrected in 2022, reaching a low of $0.9. In 2023, it ranged between $1.1 and $2.5. In 2024, it registered another bull run, rising from $2.11 to its all-time high of $8.24 on Jun 15, 2024. It corrected later and traded at the $5.2 mark in October and $4.98 in November when it started recovering. The recovery saw the coin rise above $6.5 in December. It then crossed into 2025, trading at $5.5. From there, it assumed a bear run as it fell below $3.8 in February and $3.0 in May. It crossed into June, trading at $3.20. In July, it fell below $3.20.

title: Crypto Enthusiast Asks XRP Holders This Critical Question
body: With XRP currently trading at $3.55 , discussions around how much of the token one needs to retire are gaining renewed attention across the crypto community. Investors are increasingly revisiting questions about what size of XRP holdings could support long-term financial independence, particularly as speculation continues about the token’s future valuation. The conversation, primarily fueled by retail investors within the XRP Army, centers around the belief that XRP could see exponential growth in the coming years. For many, even a small number of tokens could potentially yield significant wealth if bullish projections are realized. Community Perspectives on Retirement Thresholds A recent discussion led by a known figure in the XRP community, Jeremiah, asked members to share their thoughts on the number of tokens they believe would be sufficient for retirement. The responses highlighted a wide range of perspectives, with opinions varying from conservative estimates to highly ambitious predictions. How much XRP do you think is needed to retire comfortably? I am curious to see what you think. #XRP pic.twitter.com/EF1tu9s37Y — GenXRP (@JeremiahB45) July 20, 2025 Some users suggested that owning 10,000 XRP could provide a path to financial security, implying expectations that the token could rise to values exceeding $100. Others proposed that 60,000 XRP would be a safer benchmark, though Jeremiah challenged this, asserting that a smaller quantity might be sufficient due to future market dynamics. Another user took an even more optimistic position, arguing that as little as 1,000 XRP could eventually be enough to retire. Jeremiah reiterated this sentiment, citing anticipated reductions in available supply over the next five years as a potential driver of significant price increases. High-Value Projections Stir Debate Perhaps the most striking claim came from a community member named Marc, who proposed that just 100 XRP could be sufficient for a comfortable retirement. Jeremiah supported this assertion, reinforcing a highly optimistic outlook. For this scenario to materialize, XRP would need to exceed $10,000 per token, an increase of over 285,000% from its current price. Although these projections are met with skepticism even within the XRP community, some well-known figures have shared similar views. For instance, crypto entrepreneur Jake Claver has suggested that XRP could reach $10,000 by 2027. Nonetheless, such projections are controversial and far from consensus. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Factors That Influence Value While much of the discussion centers on specific amounts of XRP, some investors have emphasized that the real determining factors lie elsewhere. Adoption rates, regulatory clarity, and technological developments are all seen as critical components in shaping the token’s long-term value. O ne user compared the current situation to the evolution of Bitcoin, noting that what once seemed like a sufficient amount for retirement has changed over time as the asset matured. These perspectives reflect a broader understanding that price predictions must be grounded in market fundamentals, rather than speculation alone. Although there is no clear consensus on the exact amount of XRP needed to achieve financial independence, confidence in the token’s long-term potential remains high among supporters. Community projections range widely, from XRP reaching $100 to as much as $10,000, with some even suggesting that a $500 price point may eventually be considered cheap. In the absence of certainty, investors are making decisions based on their individual risk tolerance and faith in XRP’s future value. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. The views expressed in this article may include the author’s personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid’s opinion. Readers are urged to do in-depth research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. title: Top Analysts See Avalanche (AVAX) Positioned to Outperform Ripple (XRP) in the Upcoming Bull Market
body: As crypto markets warm up for what could be a full-blown altcoin cycle, top analysts are pointing to Avalanche (AVAX) as the infrastructure play most likely to outperform Ripple (XRP) in the next leg up. Strong ETF momentum, enterprise integrations, and record transaction volume are positioning AVAX ahead of the curve, especially as capital begins rotating from legacy altcoins to scalable, institutionally compliant ecosystems. But while Avalanche garners analyst nods, the real whispers—the alpha group calls, Telegram tags, and early-stage radar lists—are fixated on one name: MAGACOIN FINANCE . MAGA (MAGACOIN FINANCE): The Cultural Breakout with Strategic Timing While Avalanche and XRP fight for institutional favor, a different kind of breakout is quietly taking shape beneath the headlines. Early spots in MAGACOIN FINANCE are filling up fast as presale momentum surges ahead of the official launch. Analysts, presale dashboards, and smart money trackers are all converging on one point: this is not just another token drop. It’s an ideological asset structured for scale, built around full decentralization, no VC interference, and fixed-supply scarcity. Recent upgrades—like live cross-wallet compatibility with MetaMask, Trust Wallet, and Coinbase Wallet—have accelerated adoption. Telegram activity is doubling weekly, and verified audit reports from HashEx and CertiK are drawing in a wave of credibility-focused investors. The key? Timing. As the ETF money floods into Bitcoin and Ethereum, and smart money rotates into infrastructure like AVAX, MAGACOIN is becoming the narrative play of choice for retail and alpha groups. This is where culture meets conviction—where early positioning isn’t optional, it’s everything. And that window? It’s closing fast. Premium token allocations, governance rights, and staking multipliers are only available during the presale stage. After listing, the game changes. Avalanche (AVAX): Institutional Infrastructure Meets Scalable Utility Avalanche is fast proving itself as more than just a high-speed Layer 1. The network just posted a record 20 million daily transactions on July 15, and major firms are responding. Crypto Finance, a subsidiary of Deutsche Börse, added AVAX to its regulated infrastructure stack this month, enabling European banks and brokers to offer secure trading and custody. This follows news that Grayscale’s AVAX ETF proposal is under review by the SEC, with a decision expected in Q3. Analysts are increasingly confident the ETF will be approved, especially as Avalanche builds out its institutional footprint with strategic partners like Lynq for enterprise payments. Price-wise, AVAX is up 15% this month, with short-term targets between $24–$26. Long-range projections hit the $50 mark by end-of-year, assuming ETF approval and continued ecosystem growth. Ripple (XRP): Big News, But Heavier Baggage Ripple isn’t staying quiet. XRP recently hit an all-time high above $3.60, fueled by speculation surrounding U.S. regulatory clarity, including the GENIUS and CLARITY Acts aimed at formalizing stablecoin and digital asset legislation. The ongoing SEC lawsuit appeal decision, scheduled around July 17, remains a wild card. If dropped, it could send XRP even higher. But even with favorable outcomes, many institutional desks remain hesitant due to the token’s ongoing legal baggage and centralized structure. Even with bullish targets between $10 and $21, analysts admit XRP’s growth is likely slower and more compliance-bound than that of Avalanche or newer decentralized tokens entering the scene. Conclusion Avalanche is building institutional bridges and crushing transaction records—clear signs of a protocol ready for next-cycle dominance. Ripple continues to lean on legislation and legacy name recognition, but its runway feels limited compared to leaner, faster competitors MAGACOIN FINANCE isn’t waiting for permission. It’s building community, infrastructure, and narrative weight at the ground level. And for those with the foresight to move before the crowd, it may just be the most asymmetric opportunity of the 2025 cycle. To learn more about MAGACOIN FINANCE, visit: Website: https://magacoinfinance.com Twitter/X: https://x.com/magacoinfinance Telegram: https://t.me/magacoinfinance Continue Reading: Top Analysts See Avalanche (AVAX) Positioned to Outperform Ripple (XRP) in the Upcoming Bull Market

title: XRP Transactions Barrels Over $1 Billion To Monthly Highs, Are Whales Driving The Next Leg?
body: XRP is making headlines once again as its network records a dramatic surge, surpassing $1 billion in daily transfer volume for the first time in over a month. The spike comes on the heels of a powerful price rally, with possible signs that large holders, also called whales, may be playing a key role in driving the cryptocurrency’s next leg. XRP Transactions Hit Major Highs The XRP network is showing renewed strength and growth as transaction volumes have skyrocketed to over $1.07 billion. This spike follows a massive 67% rally in the digital asset’s price, which climbed above $3.5 earlier this month after a long period of consolidation. This impressive price surge marks one of the most aggressive upward moves in recent months. Related Reading: Pundit Warns XRP Investors To Not Make This Grave Mistake This Cycle The resurgence in both network activity and price signals is growing market momentum and possibly a shift in sentiment among investors and traders. Notably, XRPScan, a platform that records data from the XRP Ledger, revealed that the large-scale transfer volume was recorded on July 18, representing the cryptocurrency’s largest single-day figure in over a month. What’s particularly notable about this recent volume surge is that it does not appear driven by speculative churn alone. The elevated flow of funds between accounts and the increase in user addresses suggest a deeper level of network usage. Data from XRPScan shows that XRP payment volume from one account to another rose to 1.72 billion on July 18. Additionally, the number of successful transactions executed around the same time totalled over 2.08 million. New active accounts have also climbed significantly, with July 18 recording the highest daily count over the last month at 10,279. With blockchain metrics flashing green and XRP’s price reclaiming bullish momentum, the surge in daily transfer volume signals a fresh wave of bullish confidence among holders. Typically, such synchronised growth may point to deliberate accumulation or distribution by whales, who often move large sums during pivotal market shifts. Whales Go Long On XRP Ahead Of Potential Surge New reports from analysts indicate that XRP whale activity is back in full swing, with specific holders going long just days after the cryptocurrency network surged past $1 billion in transfer volume. Multiple long positions totalling over $3.8 million have been opened at a price point near $3.44, raising speculation that deep-pocketed investors may be acting on insider-level confidence. KingXRP, an analyst on X social media, revealed that a whale recently entered a $1.52 million long on XRP, just as buzz grows around the impending RealFi integration that could enable the XRP Ledger to unlock a massive $650 trillion market. Related Reading: XRP Open Interest Just Hit A Fresh ATH Above $10 Billion, Will Price Follow Next? Adding fuel to the hype, Radar, another market expert, reported that two additional whale-sized positions, worth $1.02 million and $1.31 million, were opened within the same price range. This move signals a clear shift in whale sentiment, suggesting increased confidence in XRP’s breakout potential. Featured image from Getty Images, chart from Tradingview.com

title: Cantor Fitzgerald offers to buy the rights in potential refunds from companies that have paid Trump’s tariffs
body: Cantor Fitzgerald, a financial services company led by the sons of US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, has offered to buy the right to hundreds of millions of dollars in potential refunds from companies that have paid Trump’s tariffs. The offer means that the sons of the pro-tariff commerce secretary, Kyle and Brandon, have made a way for investors to bet that President Donald Trump’s signature tariffs will be struck down in court. Lutnick has been one of the most vocal supporters of the president’s tariff policies. According to him, tariffs can potentially raise “hundreds and hundreds of billions of dollars” in revenue for the US. His reason is that the need for Americans making under $150,000 to pay taxes will eventually be eliminated. Here’s the tariff buy deal According to the court, if Trump’s tariffs are permanently blocked, businesses that began paying “Liberation Day” tariffs on April 2 could be refunded, with interest. Now, Cantor Fitzgerald is jumping at this opportunity. Here is the deal. According to reports, a representative from Cantor said the firm is willing to trade tariff refund rights for 20% to 30% of what companies have paid in duties. The representative wrote, “So for a company that paid $10 million, they could expect to receive $2-$3 million in a trade We have the capacity to trade up to several hundred million of these presently and can likely upsize that in the future to meet potential demand.” Some companies are sold Some companies are sold. It is too suspicious that the 20-year-old made the decision by themselves. There are arguments that most companies raised prices to offset the cost of tariffs; therefore, it is the consumers who were affected most. Also, because of an uncertain timeline and mounting financial pressures, some companies may decide it’s wiser to accept the offer. In addition, others don’t want to deal with the court directly. Ryan Petersen, CEO of the logistics technology company Flexport, said, “When you file those things today, it takes six to 12 months to get your money back once approved, it’s a physical check that arrives in the mail […] I think it may be attractive for some people.” Experts say the deals are used by financial firms seeking to profit from potential legal settlements. Many lawsuits can take years to resolve, and the structure can allow individuals and companies to get money upfront or have their lawyer fees covered. According to US Customs and Border Protection data, billions of dollars have been collected under Trump’s new tariff policies. Experts estimate nearly $14 billion could be refunded if the ruling is upheld on appeal. According to reports, Cantor has already made a major deal. “We’ve already put a trade through representing about ~$10 million of IEEPA Rights and anticipate that number will balloon in the coming weeks,” the Cantor representative claimed. At 20-30 cents on the dollar their clients are pricing in better than 3:1 odds of an overturn. About 3x the current odds on your polymarket. pic.twitter.com/KsF9wb2uMX — Dave Rekuc (@DaveRekuc) July 21, 2025 On the other hand, Polymarket thinks that Trump will not need to refund the tariffs. Only 11% of the bettors think that Trump will do the refund. Lutnick says he is not involved Kristen Eichamer, press secretary for the Department of Commerce, said that Lutnick is not aware of the decision. She said that Lutnick has no insight or strategic control over Cantor Fitzgerald. She added, “He has fully complied with the terms of his ethics agreement with respect to divesture and recusals and will continue to do so.” However, according to Tim Meyer, a professor of international business law at Duke University School of Law, the bank’s decision has revealed what those with connections to the administration think about the merits of the tariffs. title: Ethereum Shatters Inflow Records, Pulls in $2.12 Billion in a Week
body: Ethereum led digital asset inflows last week as it recorded a staggering $2.12 billion. The figure was nearly double its previous record. This surge helped push total digital asset investment product inflows to an all-time weekly high of $4.39 billion, surpassing the prior record of $4.27 billion set after the US presidential election in December 2024. Altcoins Join Ethereum’s Rally In the latest edition of the ‘Digital Asset Fund Flows Weekly Report,’ CoinShares revealed that Ethereum has been on a strong run. Inflows from the past 13 weeks now account for 23% of its total assets under management. This year alone, it has pulled in $6.2 billion and has already topped the full-year inflows seen in 2024. This comes as total assets under management hit a record $220 billion, while global weekly trading turnover in ETPs also reached a record $39.2 billion. Bitcoin attracted $2.2 billion in inflows this week, down from last week’s $2.7 billion. ETP trading volumes accounted for 55% of its exchange activity. Meanwhile, Solana led altcoin inflows with $39 million, followed by XRP at $36 million and Sui at $9.3 million. During the same period, Chainlink and Cardano recorded smaller inflows of $0.9 million and $0.3 million. Multi-asset products were the only cohort to have recorded outflows of $16.4 million over the past week. With altcoins pulling notable inflows, the data indicates growing investor appetite for assets beyond Bitcoin. In fact, QCP Capital noted that Bitcoin dominance slipped from 64% to 60% over the past week, while, at the same time, Ethereum’s market share rose from 9.7% to 11.6%. If this trend continues, QCP expects the next phase of altcoin season could already be underway. Regional Crypto Flows Flows were largely driven by the US, which attracted $4.37 billion during the week. Switzerland followed with $47.3 million, while Australia and Hong Kong recorded $17.3 million and $14.1 million, respectively. Canada also saw modest inflows of $3 million. Brazil and Sweden, on the other hand, posted outflows of $28.1 million and $21 million. Germany also saw $15.5 million in weekly outflows. The post Ethereum Shatters Inflow Records, Pulls in $2.12 Billion in a Week appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Altcoin Trading Sees Explosive $100 Billion Surge on Binance Futures
body: BitcoinWorld Altcoin Trading Sees Explosive $100 Billion Surge on Binance Futures The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with activity, and if you’ve been keeping an eye on the markets, you’ve likely noticed a significant shift. The spotlight, for a while, seemed to be solely on Bitcoin’s incredible journey to new all-time highs. However, a recent and truly astounding development has emerged from the derivatives market: altcoin trading on Binance Futures has reached unprecedented levels, signaling a dramatic resurgence of interest beyond the king of crypto. This isn’t just a minor blip; we’re talking about a daily volume exceeding a staggering $100 billion. What does this massive influx mean for the market, and why are retail investors suddenly flocking back to altcoins with such fervor? What’s Driving the Explosive Altcoin Trading Surge on Binance Futures? The recent analysis by CryptoQuant contributor Maartunn brought to light an incredible statistic: daily altcoin trading volume on Binance Futures soared to an astounding $100.7 billion. This figure represents the highest volume recorded since February 3rd, marking a significant rebound after a prolonged period of relatively quiet activity. This surge didn’t happen in isolation; it followed closely on the heels of Bitcoin achieving a new all-time high, creating a ripple effect across the broader crypto landscape. While Bitcoin’s trading activity has remained robust, its stability pales in comparison to the dynamic shift seen in altcoins. Maartunn’s data indicates that altcoin trading now commands a dominant share of 71% of the total futures activity on Binance. This overwhelming majority suggests a profound change in market sentiment and participation. The prevailing theory, put forth by Maartunn himself, is that this shift is a clear reflection of renewed interest from retail investors who are confidently re-entering the market, eager to explore opportunities beyond Bitcoin. To put this into perspective, consider the typical market cycle. Often, Bitcoin leads the charge, breaking new ground and drawing institutional and large-scale investor attention. Once Bitcoin stabilizes or enters a consolidation phase, capital tends to flow into altcoins, a phenomenon often referred to as “altcoin season.” The current surge in altcoin trading volume on Binance Futures strongly suggests we might be entering, or are already deep within, such a phase, driven by the collective enthusiasm of individual traders looking for higher potential returns. How Does This Altcoin Trading Volume Compare, and Why Does It Matter? Understanding the sheer scale of $100.7 billion in daily altcoin trading volume requires context. It’s not just a big number; it signifies robust liquidity, increased price discovery, and heightened market participation. For traders, higher volume often means tighter spreads, easier execution of large orders, and more reliable price movements. For the market as a whole, it indicates health and growing adoption. Let’s look at a simplified comparison of volume distribution on Binance Futures: Asset Category Approximate Share of Futures Volume Implied Daily Volume (Based on $100.7B Altcoin Volume) Altcoins 71% $100.7 billion Bitcoin 29% ~$41.1 billion (approx. calculated from 100.7 / 0.71 * 0.29) Total Futures Volume 100% ~$141.8 billion This table clearly illustrates the dominance of altcoin trading in the current futures market landscape on Binance. The surge in altcoin volume, rather than just Bitcoin, suggests that traders are actively seeking higher beta assets – those that tend to move more dramatically than Bitcoin – in pursuit of amplified returns. This dynamic is a hallmark of a maturing bull market, where confidence in the overall crypto ecosystem encourages exploration into more volatile, yet potentially rewarding, assets. Navigating the Opportunities in Altcoin Trading: What Should You Consider? For many, the allure of altcoin trading lies in its potential for significant gains. While Bitcoin’s growth might be more steady, altcoins, especially those with smaller market caps or strong technological developments, can experience parabolic price movements. This creates exciting opportunities for traders who are willing to research and take calculated risks. Here are some key opportunities and considerations: Diversification: Beyond Bitcoin and Ethereum, the altcoin market offers a vast array of projects, each with unique use cases and technological innovations. This allows investors to diversify their portfolios and potentially tap into different growth narratives, such as DeFi, NFTs, GameFi, or Layer 2 solutions. Higher Volatility, Higher Potential Returns: The very nature of altcoins means they can be more volatile than Bitcoin. While this carries increased risk, it also presents opportunities for quick profits if one can accurately predict market movements. Early Adoption of Promising Projects: Engaging in altcoin trading can mean getting in early on projects that could become the next big thing. Identifying undervalued gems before they gain mainstream attention can lead to substantial returns. However, successful participation requires more than just chasing pumps. It demands diligent research, understanding market trends, and a disciplined approach to risk management. Looking at projects with strong fundamentals, active development teams, clear roadmaps, and genuine utility can provide a more sustainable approach to navigating the altcoin space. Are There Risks to This Altcoin Trading Boom, Especially for Retail Investors? While the surge in altcoin trading volume presents exciting opportunities, it’s crucial to acknowledge the inherent risks, especially for retail investors who might be newer to the volatile world of cryptocurrencies. The same volatility that offers high reward potential also carries significant downside risk. Here are some challenges to be aware of: Extreme Price Volatility: Altcoins, particularly those with lower liquidity, can experience rapid and drastic price swings. What goes up quickly can come down even faster, leading to substantial losses if not managed properly. “Pump and Dump” Schemes: The influx of retail interest can unfortunately attract malicious actors who attempt to artificially inflate an altcoin’s price (pump) only to sell off their holdings at the peak, leaving late buyers with heavy losses (dump). Information Asymmetry: Retail investors often lack the sophisticated tools and deep market insights available to institutional players, making them more susceptible to misinformation or FUD (Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt) and FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out). Liquidity Issues: While the overall altcoin volume is high, individual altcoins, especially newer or smaller ones, might still suffer from low liquidity, making it difficult to enter or exit positions without significantly impacting the price. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for altcoins remains evolving in many jurisdictions, which can introduce unforeseen risks or impact the long-term viability of certain projects. To mitigate these risks, it’s paramount for retail investors to exercise caution, conduct thorough due diligence, and never invest more than they can afford to lose. Employing stop-loss orders, diversifying investments, and avoiding emotional decisions are critical practices for safer altcoin trading . The Pivotal Role of Binance Futures in Facilitating Altcoin Trading Binance Futures has cemented its position as a leading platform for cryptocurrency derivatives, and its role in facilitating this massive surge in altcoin trading cannot be overstated. The platform offers a wide array of altcoin perpetual contracts, allowing traders to speculate on price movements with leverage, without owning the underlying asset. This accessibility, combined with Binance’s extensive liquidity and user-friendly interface, makes it a preferred choice for millions of traders worldwide. The ability to use leverage amplifies both potential gains and losses, which is a key attraction for retail investors looking to maximize their exposure with relatively smaller capital. While powerful, leverage also significantly increases risk, underscoring the need for careful risk management strategies. Binance’s robust infrastructure and continuous introduction of new altcoin trading pairs further contribute to its dominance in this segment, acting as a major catalyst for the current volume boom. What Does This Mean for the Future of Altcoin Trading and the Crypto Market? The resurgence in altcoin trading volume, particularly driven by retail investors, paints an interesting picture for the future of the crypto market. It suggests a broadening of market participation beyond Bitcoin, indicating a growing comfort and understanding among the general public regarding the diverse opportunities within the crypto ecosystem. This increased engagement can lead to more innovation, better project development, and a more robust overall market. If this trend continues, we could see a sustained period of growth for various altcoin sectors. However, it also means that market participants, especially new entrants, must remain vigilant. Education and responsible trading practices will be more critical than ever to navigate the opportunities and challenges that come with such high-volume, retail-driven movements. The market is dynamic, and staying informed about both the potential rewards and inherent risks is key to long-term success in altcoin trading . In conclusion, the recent surge in altcoin trading volume on Binance Futures to over $100 billion daily is a clear signal of renewed retail investor enthusiasm and a significant shift in market dynamics. This unprecedented activity, highlighted by CryptoQuant’s analysis, underscores the growing importance of altcoins in the broader cryptocurrency landscape. While it presents exciting opportunities for substantial gains and diversification, it also comes with inherent risks such as extreme volatility and the potential for market manipulation. For both seasoned traders and new entrants, understanding these dynamics, conducting thorough research, and practicing disciplined risk management are paramount to navigating this exhilarating period successfully. The altcoin market is alive and booming, offering a vibrant, albeit challenging, frontier for those looking to participate in the next wave of crypto innovation. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What exactly is altcoin trading? A1: Altcoin trading refers to the buying and selling of cryptocurrencies other than Bitcoin (BTC). The term “altcoin” is a portmanteau of “alternative coin,” encompassing thousands of different digital assets, each with its own technology, use case, and community. This can include major coins like Ethereum (ETH), Ripple (XRP), and Cardano (ADA), as well as smaller, newer projects. Q2: Why is altcoin volume surging on Binance Futures? A2: The surge is attributed to several factors, primarily renewed interest from retail investors. Following Bitcoin’s new all-time high, capital often flows into altcoins as traders seek higher potential returns. Binance Futures, being a leading derivatives platform, offers leverage and a wide range of altcoin contracts, making it an attractive venue for this increased trading activity. Q3: What are the main risks associated with altcoin trading? A3: Key risks include extreme price volatility, which can lead to rapid and significant losses. Altcoins are also more susceptible to “pump and dump” schemes and liquidity issues. Furthermore, the evolving regulatory environment and the inherent speculative nature of many altcoin projects add layers of uncertainty. It’s crucial to understand these risks before engaging in altcoin trading . Q4: How can retail investors participate safely in altcoin trading? A4: To participate safely, retail investors should prioritize thorough research into projects, understand their own risk tolerance, and never invest more than they can afford to lose. Employing risk management strategies like setting stop-loss orders, diversifying portfolios, and avoiding emotional trading decisions are vital. Staying informed about market trends and security best practices is also essential. Q5: What is Binance Futures? A5: Binance Futures is the derivatives trading platform offered by Binance, one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges. It allows users to trade cryptocurrency futures contracts, including perpetual contracts, on various digital assets like Bitcoin and altcoins. Traders can use leverage to amplify their positions, speculating on price movements without directly owning the underlying cryptocurrency. Q6: Does this altcoin trading surge mean an “altcoin season” is here? A6: While the significant increase in altcoin trading volume and dominance over Bitcoin volume on futures platforms strongly suggests a period favorable to altcoins, often referred to as “altcoin season,” it’s not a guaranteed outcome. It indicates a strong likelihood of continued interest and potential for altcoin growth, but market dynamics can change rapidly. Traders should remain vigilant and adapt their strategies accordingly. title: Germany’s Chancellor Friedrich Merz criticizes EU proposal to mandate electric-only fleet purchases by 2030
body: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has criticized a draft European Union plan that would force rental car companies and large corporations to switch their entire vehicle fleets to electric models by 2030, calling the proposal out of touch with economic and practical realities across the bloc. “The proposals announced over the weekend regarding rental car fleets and electrification completely ignore the needs we have in Europe right now,” Merz said . “These are not the proposals that are right. Rather, we want to remain technologically open.” The policy, still under internal discussion at the EU level , would require firms like Sixt SE and Europcar Mobility Group to buy only electric vehicles from the start of the next decade, part of a wider effort to decarbonize transport, one of Europe’s highest-polluting sectors. Brussels’ blueprint gets backlash from Berlin Underpinning the plan is the belief that targeting corporate and rental car fleets offers a fast-track route to cutting emissions: rental companies are among the largest buyers of new vehicles in Europe, and once those cars are resold into used markets, they could significantly boost EV adoption among consumers. But Merz’s pushback is part of a growing resistance from national capitals wary of overreach from Brussels. The German leader, already locked in budget fights with the EU, has made clear that Berlin won’t rubber-stamp climate mandates that he says pile unrealistic expectations on businesses and citizens. The European Commission has not yet released formal legislative text, but early drafts shared with national delegations indicate a strong push to make fleet electrification mandatory by 2030, with few exceptions. Europe’s green unity under financial pressure Automakers, too, are watching the debate closely. For companies still heavily reliant on combustion-engine models for revenue, the timeline could force difficult choices about production lines and supply chain contracts. Germany , in particular, has long argued for a more flexible approach to mobility decarbonization. While it supports reducing emissions, Berlin has consistently championed technological neutrality, pushing to keep options like synthetic fuels and hydrogen on the table. The fleet electrification plan would go beyond the EU’s goal of banning the sale of new internal combustion engine vehicles by 2035. While that policy has already sparked debate, this latest move ups the stakes by shifting the timeline forward and putting the burden on businesses first. According to a Brussels lawmaker, the proposal could affect 60% of the new car business. Supporters within the European Commission argue that time is of the essence. After a summer of record temperatures and intensifying pressure from COP29 commitments, Brussels sees transport emissions as one of the few remaining areas where aggressive policy can deliver fast climate wins. title: North Korean Lazarus Group Linked to $44.2 Million CoinDCX Crypto Heist
body: The cyberattack on the Indian crypto exchange CoinDCX, which resulted in a loss of $44.2 million, has been linked to the North Korean Lazarus Group. This was reported by CryptoSlate, citing Deddy Lavid, CEO of Cyvers. Lavid noted that the attackers acted according to a scheme very similar to previous operations conducted by DPRK (North Korean) hackers. One of the distinctive features of their tactics is the use of the cryptomixer Tornado Cash and cross-chain bridges to conceal the flow of funds. On July 19, CoinDCX reported the compromise of an internal account used to provide liquidity on a third-party platform. Lavid speculated that the attackers gained access to the backend via open API keys, improper system settings, or vulnerabilities in account permissions. Once inside, they used legitimate account privileges to transfer assets from Solana to Ethereum, subsequently laundering the funds through Tornado Cash. According to Lavid, the sophistication of the attack and in-depth knowledge of liquidity mechanisms on centralized exchanges indicate that highly experienced and well-organized cybercriminals were involved. CoinDCX co-founder Sumit Gupta confirmed that users’ assets were not affected by the hack, and the company has already covered all losses from its own funds. The exchange has announced a bounty program, offering a reward of 25% for any recovered amounts. The team seeks assistance not only in tracing the assets, but also in identifying those responsible for the attack. ”More than recovering the stolen funds, what is important for us is to identify and catch the attackers, because such things shouldn’t happen again, not with us, not with anyone in the industry,” Gupta emphasized.

title: American Bankers Association Moves Against Ripple’s Banking License
body: Several of the largest banking and credit union trade associations in the United States have called on federal regulators to pause their review of national bank charter applications submitted by crypto firms such as Circle and Ripple. The request was made in a joint letter sent to the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), warning that approving such applications could significantly alter longstanding regulatory practices. Banking Industry Raises Concerns Over Crypto Applications The letter, signed by a coalition led by the American Bankers Association, argues that the OCC should not move forward with evaluating the applications until key legal and policy issues are resolved. According to the signatories, the business models presented by the crypto firms are vague and lack the transparency needed for proper regulatory analysis or public review. The American Bankers Association (ABA) and several banking and credit union groups have sent a letter to the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), asking it to delay the approval of national bank license applications from crypto firms like Circle and Ripple, citing… — Wu Blockchain (@WuBlockchain) July 21, 2025 A key concern involves whether the companies meet the criteria for obtaining national trust bank charters. Traditionally, this designation is reserved for institutions that engage in fiduciary services. The banking groups argue that core services offered by firms like Circle and Ripple, particularly crypto custody, do not satisfy these fiduciary requirements. They caution that moving ahead without full public consultation could result in regulatory inconsistency, and potentially allow firms with limited capital obligations to bypass decades-old financial oversight structures. Implications of a National Charter for Crypto Firms If granted, a national bank charter would allow crypto companies to operate across the United States under a single federal license, avoiding the need to apply for separate approvals in each state. While this would streamline operations for the applicants, it has raised concerns within the traditional financial sector. Critics argue that such a shift could create unequal standards, where crypto companies operate with reduced regulatory burdens compared to traditional banks. They also warn that allowing entry through trust charters could weaken overall financial safeguards and introduce new risks into the banking system. Custodia Bank founder Caitlin Long responded to the pushback on social media, noting that the reaction highlights regulatory imbalances. She suggested that if national trust charters offer lighter oversight, traditional banks might consider switching to those models to cut compliance costs. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Crypto Industry’s Regulatory Strategy in Transition The dispute reflects a broader trend in which digital asset companies are increasingly pursuing federal banking licenses to enhance credibility, expand services, and streamline compliance with evolving regulations. Firms like Circle, Ripple, and Fidelity are seeking to position themselves as key players in regulated financial markets. Legal analyst Logan Payne noted that new legislation , such as the GENIUS Act , which introduced a specialized license for stablecoin issuers, may be unintentionally encouraging companies to seek more comprehensive banking charters to maintain operational flexibility. Alexander Grieve, head of government affairs at crypto investment firm Paradigm, commented on the rare unity among traditional financial institutions. He stated, “Banks and credit unions rarely agree on anything. But they seem to agree that they’re finally about to have some competition from crypto.” The OCC’s decision on whether to grant federal charters to crypto firms like Ripple and Circle carries significant regulatory and competitive implications. As traditional financial institutions push back against what they see as a disruptive shift in oversight standards, the outcome will likely shape how digital asset companies engage with the U.S. banking system in the years ahead. title: Analyst Benjamin Cowen Issues Altcoin Warning, Predicts Alts Will Now ‘Bleed’ Against Ethereum
body: A closely followed analyst who accurately called that the crypto bull market will be focused on Bitcoin ( BTC ) now believes that it’s time for Ethereum ( ETH ) to shine. In November of 2024, analyst Benjamin Cowen predicted that Ethereum would “come home” or drop to its logarithmic growth trendline based on historical patterns. In April of this year, Ethereum fell to around $1,550, prompting Cowen to declare that ETH had come home. Source: Benjamin Cowen/X Now, Cowen says that Ethereum rallies will be partly fueled by capital rotation from altcoins to ETH. “If you bought ETH when it went home and feel like you are missing out on ALT rallies, consider this: The collective altcoin market is down 40% against ETH since ETH went home. We are at the: ‘Yes your alt went up, but does it bleed against Ethereum’ phase of the cycle… When ALTs bleed to BTC, be in BTC over ALTs. When ALTs bleed to ETH, be in ETH over ALTs. It’s not that complicated.” Source: Benjamin Cowen/X The analyst also believes that Ethereum has a solid shot at printing new all-time highs once it takes out a resistance level that has kept the market bearish since December 2021. “Since ETH went home, the next time it reaches $4,000, there is a good chance it actually breaks through. One way for this cycle to feel more complete is for ETH to rally to new highs sometime over the next half-year.” Source: Benjamin Cowen/X At time of writing, Ethereum is worth $3,725. title: Tokenized Securities: Citadel’s Urgent Call for Prudent SEC Regulation
body: BitcoinWorld Tokenized Securities: Citadel’s Urgent Call for Prudent SEC Regulation In the rapidly evolving landscape of digital finance, the concept of tokenized securities has emerged as a groundbreaking innovation, promising to reshape how assets are owned, traded, and managed. However, as with any transformative technology, its adoption comes with a complex web of regulatory considerations. Recently, a significant voice from the traditional financial world, American market-making firm Citadel Securities, has stepped forward, urging the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to adopt a more measured and cautious approach to the widespread embrace of tokenized securities . This pivotal intervention highlights a crucial tension between fostering innovation and ensuring robust investor protection and market stability. Why is Citadel Securities Urging Caution on Tokenized Securities? Citadel Securities, a titan in the market-making industry, plays a critical role in ensuring liquidity across various financial markets. Their recent call for caution, as reported by Bloomberg, was formally delivered in a comment letter submitted to the SEC’s Crypto Task Force on July 21. The core of their argument revolves around the potential for significant disruption and unintended consequences if traditional securities regulations are simply relaxed or sidestepped to accommodate tokenized securities . The firm articulated several key concerns: Investor Confusion: Citadel fears that a hasty adoption without clear guidelines could lead to a bewildering environment for investors. Without well-defined rules, distinguishing between different types of digital assets, understanding their underlying value, and navigating their unique risks could become exceptionally difficult for the average investor. This lack of clarity could expose individuals to unforeseen losses. Regulatory Imbalances: A major point of contention for Citadel is the potential for an uneven playing field. They argue that relaxing established securities regulations for tokenized securities could create an imbalance between traditional exchanges and publicly traded companies, which operate under stringent oversight, and the emerging digital asset platforms. Such an imbalance could inadvertently favor less regulated entities, potentially undermining market fairness and integrity. Market Stability: The sheer scale and interconnectedness of global financial markets mean that any significant shift, particularly one involving novel technologies, must be managed with extreme care. Citadel’s caution stems from a desire to prevent systemic risks that could arise from poorly regulated or understood digital asset markets impacting the broader financial ecosystem. Instead of a piecemeal or reactive approach, Citadel has strongly recommended that the issue of tokenization be addressed through a formal rulemaking process. This would involve a structured, transparent, and comprehensive public consultation, allowing all stakeholders – from financial institutions to technology innovators and consumer advocates – to contribute to the development of robust and future-proof regulations. Such a process would ensure that any framework for tokenized securities is thoughtfully constructed, balancing the promise of innovation with the imperative of investor protection. Understanding Tokenized Securities: A Brief Overview Before diving deeper into the regulatory debate, it’s essential to grasp what tokenized securities truly are. At their core, tokenized securities are digital representations of traditional assets—like stocks, bonds, real estate, or even fine art—issued and managed on a blockchain. This process leverages distributed ledger technology (DLT) to create a unique, verifiable, and often fractionalized digital token that represents ownership or rights to an underlying asset. The allure of tokenized securities lies in several potential benefits: Increased Liquidity: By fractionalizing high-value assets, tokenization can make them accessible to a wider range of investors, potentially increasing their liquidity. Greater Transparency: Blockchain’s immutable ledger can offer enhanced transparency regarding ownership, transaction history, and asset provenance. Reduced Costs: Automation through smart contracts can streamline processes, potentially reducing intermediaries and associated costs. Faster Settlement: Blockchain-based transactions can settle much faster than traditional securities, often in minutes rather than days. Global Accessibility: Digital tokens can be traded across borders more easily, opening up new investment opportunities. However, alongside these benefits come significant challenges, many of which are at the heart of Citadel’s concerns: Regulatory Ambiguity: The primary challenge is fitting these new digital instruments into existing legal and regulatory frameworks. Technological Risks: Cybersecurity threats, smart contract vulnerabilities, and platform stability are ongoing concerns. Interoperability: Ensuring different blockchain networks and traditional financial systems can communicate effectively remains a hurdle. Custody and Security: Securely managing digital keys and assets requires specialized infrastructure and expertise. What Does This Mean for the Future of Tokenized Securities? Citadel’s intervention underscores a critical juncture for the development of tokenized securities . On one hand, the technology offers undeniable efficiencies and new avenues for investment. On the other, the financial markets are built on centuries of established rules designed to protect participants and maintain stability. The future trajectory of tokenized securities will largely depend on how effectively regulators, industry players, and innovators can bridge this gap. The call for a formal rulemaking process suggests a desire for clarity and certainty. Without a comprehensive framework, widespread institutional adoption of tokenized securities will likely remain limited. Investors and large firms require a predictable regulatory environment to commit significant capital and resources. This isn’t just about preventing harm; it’s also about fostering sustainable growth and innovation. For those interested in this space, here are some actionable insights: Stay Informed: Keep a close eye on SEC pronouncements and industry discussions surrounding digital asset regulation. Understand the Nuances: Differentiate between various types of digital assets (e.g., utility tokens, stablecoins, tokenized securities ) and their respective regulatory treatments. Prioritize Compliance: For businesses exploring tokenization, ensuring compliance with existing and evolving regulations should be paramount. The debate highlights a broader theme: how traditional finance grapples with the decentralized and often borderless nature of blockchain technology. It’s a dance between innovation and control, where striking the right balance is paramount for the long-term health and credibility of the digital asset ecosystem. Navigating the Regulatory Landscape for Tokenized Securities The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) stands at the forefront of regulating tokenized securities . Their challenge is multifaceted: how to apply existing securities laws, which were largely conceived in the pre-digital era, to novel blockchain-based instruments. The ‘Howey Test,’ a legal precedent used to determine if an asset qualifies as an ‘investment contract’ and thus a security, is often applied, but its application to every new form of digital asset can be complex and lead to varying interpretations. Citadel’s request for a formal rulemaking process for tokenized securities is a significant development because it advocates for a proactive, rather than reactive, approach. Rulemaking involves a public notice-and-comment period, allowing the SEC to gather input from a broad spectrum of stakeholders. This collaborative approach can lead to regulations that are not only legally sound but also practical and reflective of market realities. Such a process could address: Issuance Standards: Clear guidelines for how tokenized securities can be issued, including disclosure requirements. Trading Platforms: Regulations for exchanges and platforms that facilitate the trading of these assets, ensuring fairness and preventing market manipulation. Custody and Transfer: Rules governing the secure custody of digital assets and the legal framework for their transfer of ownership. Jurisdictional Clarity: Addressing cross-border implications and international cooperation in regulating these global assets. The outcome of this regulatory discourse will undoubtedly shape the pace and nature of adoption for tokenized securities . A well-defined, robust framework could unlock immense potential, attracting more institutional capital and fostering mainstream acceptance. Conversely, a fragmented or overly restrictive approach could stifle innovation and push development to jurisdictions with clearer or more favorable regulatory environments. The stakes are incredibly high for the future of digital finance. In conclusion, Citadel Securities’ call for the SEC to slow down and formally address tokenized securities through rulemaking is a crucial moment for the digital asset space. It underscores the vital need for a balanced approach that embraces the transformative potential of blockchain technology while safeguarding investors and maintaining the integrity of financial markets. The journey towards a fully integrated digital financial future is complex, but with thoughtful regulation, the promise of tokenized securities can be realized responsibly and securely. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What are tokenized securities? Tokenized securities are digital representations of traditional assets (like stocks, bonds, or real estate) that are issued and managed on a blockchain. Each token represents ownership or a right to a portion of the underlying asset, leveraging blockchain technology for transparency, efficiency, and fractionalization. Why is Citadel Securities concerned about tokenized securities? Citadel Securities is concerned that without proper regulation, the rapid adoption of tokenized securities could lead to investor confusion, create regulatory imbalances between traditional and digital markets, and potentially introduce systemic risks. They advocate for a formal rulemaking process to ensure comprehensive and well-thought-out regulations. What is a formal rulemaking process for tokenized securities? A formal rulemaking process involves the SEC proposing new regulations, publishing them for public comment, and then finalizing them after considering feedback. Citadel believes this transparent and collaborative approach is essential for developing robust and clear rules for tokenized securities , ensuring all stakeholders have a voice. How do tokenized securities differ from cryptocurrencies? While both utilize blockchain technology, tokenized securities represent ownership in real-world assets and are subject to securities laws, similar to traditional stocks or bonds. Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin or Ethereum, on the other hand, are typically designed as native digital currencies or utility tokens within their own blockchain networks and often function as mediums of exchange or decentralized applications, with different regulatory classifications. What are the potential benefits of tokenized securities? The potential benefits of tokenized securities include increased liquidity through fractional ownership, enhanced transparency due to blockchain’s immutable ledger, faster and more efficient settlement times, reduced costs by minimizing intermediaries, and greater global accessibility for a wider range of investors. Will Citadel’s stance slow down the adoption of tokenized securities? Citadel’s stance might encourage a more deliberate and cautious pace for the widespread adoption of tokenized securities in the short term. However, in the long term, a well-defined regulatory framework resulting from such a process could actually accelerate adoption by providing the clarity and certainty that institutional investors and traditional financial players require to confidently enter this emerging market. If you found this article insightful, consider sharing it with your network! Help us spread awareness about the critical discussions shaping the future of finance and tokenized securities . This post Tokenized Securities: Citadel’s Urgent Call for Prudent SEC Regulation first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Jerome Powell has been referred for criminal investigation to the DOJ
body: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell could face legal scrutiny after a criminal referral by U.S. Representative Anna Paulina Luna. The Florida congresswoman has alleged that Powell testified f alsely about the renovation of the Eccles Building of the Federal Reserve at a high cost. In a letter to the Justice Department, Luna claimed Powell testified falsely before the Senate Banking Committee on June 25. She provided discrepancies in his utterances on the additional cost of the $600 million. She also described his utterances as material statements of falsity. According to Luna, Powell lied that these changes were minor, as was the case in internal documents that were examined by the congressional investigators. The accusation also contends that Powell had written a letter to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, Russel Vought, where he allegedly downplayed the importance of the renovation changes . Legal stakes are rising The criminal referral escalates the tension between Powell and President Donald Trump, who had urged a considerable interest rate reduction numerous times. Recently, Trump advised the Federal Open Market Committee to reduce rates by 300 basis points. These trends in the current market anticipate a 56.1% possibility of the Fed cutting interest rates during its September meeting this week. Analysts say that this has boosted expectations. A lthough Trump has pondered the possibility of firing Powell, he has told news outlets there is no such possibility. But he said the heightened scrutiny might prompt Powell to resign, should any legal or reputation pressure come to bear. The referral further reinforces the criticism Trump has constantly issued concerning Powell’s unwillingness to be aggressive in monetary policy. Powell could face up to five years in prison and financial penalties if found guilty of perjury. The Department of Justice has not yet responded to the referral, and no official charges have been filed. White Hou se denies i nfluence from the Treasury Secretary Reports from the Wall Street Journal suggested that Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent played a role in convincing Trump not to dismiss Powell. However, Trump publicly denied any such influence in a social media post on Sunday. “Nobody had to explain that to me,” Trump wrote. “I know better than anybody what’s good for the Market, and what’s good for the U.S.A.” In an interview with CNBC, Bessent did not entirely push the account recorded by the Journal but reiterated that Trump seeks many people’s opinions before making decisions. “ The president draws advice from a wide range of allies and advisors,” he said. According to the report, Bess ent had cautioned Trump that dismissing Powell would provoke lawsuits and a meltdown in the financial markets. “What we need to do is examine the entire Federal Reserve institution and whether they have been successful.” Bessett Recently, Trump called Powell a “numbskull” and accused him of “making it difficult for people, especially the young, to buy a house.” The US president accused Powell of preventing the Federal Reserve from lowering interest rates to make housing more affordable. Powell took office in 2018 following Trump’s nomination of him as his successor to Janet Yellen in his first term as president. Cryptopolitan Academy: Want to grow your money in 2025? Learn how to do it with DeFi in our upcoming webclass. Save Your Spot

title: Crypto Fear & Greed Index Soars to 72: Unveiling Market Optimism
body: BitcoinWorld Crypto Fear & Greed Index Soars to 72: Unveiling Market Optimism Are you feeling the buzz in the crypto air? The digital asset market is once again capturing attention, and a key indicator, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index , has recently climbed to a notable 72. This significant jump places the market firmly in the ‘Greed’ zone, signaling a palpable shift in investor sentiment. But what exactly does this mean for you, and how should you interpret this exciting yet potentially volatile development? What is the Crypto Fear & Greed Index and Why Does It Matter? The Crypto Fear & Greed Index , a brainchild of the software development platform Alternative, is more than just a number; it’s a barometer for the collective emotional state of the cryptocurrency market. Ranging from 0 (extreme fear) to 100 (extreme greed), it aims to help investors understand whether the market is overly fearful – which could present a buying opportunity – or overly greedy – which might indicate a looming correction. On July 22, the index registered 72, a slight increase from the previous day, solidifying its position within the ‘Greed’ territory. Why is this index so important? Because human emotions often drive financial markets. Fear can lead to irrational selling, while greed can fuel impulsive buying, often at inflated prices. By quantifying these emotions, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index provides a valuable perspective, helping traders and investors make more informed decisions rather than succumbing to the whims of the crowd. It serves as a psychological pulse check for the dynamic world of digital assets. Ignoring such indicators can lead to impulsive decisions, making the index a crucial tool for anyone navigating the crypto landscape. How Does the Crypto Fear & Greed Index Work? Decoding Its Components Understanding how the Crypto Fear & Greed Index arrives at its score is crucial for appreciating its insights. It’s not just a gut feeling; it’s a sophisticated aggregation of various market factors, each weighted to reflect its influence on overall sentiment. Here’s a breakdown of the six core components that contribute to its calculation: Factor Weight What It Measures Volatility 25% Current Bitcoin volatility vs. average (30/90 days). High volatility often indicates fear. Market Momentum/Volume 25% Current trading volume and momentum. High buying volume signals greed. Social Media 15% Analysis of crypto-related keywords and sentiment on platforms like Twitter. Positive sentiment indicates greed. Surveys (Paused) 15% Public opinion polls on market sentiment. (Currently paused) Bitcoin Dominance 10% Bitcoin’s market cap share. Increasing dominance can signal fear (move to safety). Google Trends 10% Search queries for crypto terms. Fearful searches vs. curious/buying interest searches. By combining these diverse data points, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index offers a holistic view of market psychology, moving beyond simple price action to capture the underlying sentiment. This multi-faceted approach ensures a more robust and reliable indicator for crypto enthusiasts. Navigating the ‘Greed’ Zone: Opportunities and Risks for Crypto Fear & Greed Index Observers The current reading of 72 on the Crypto Fear & Greed Index firmly places us in the ‘Greed’ zone. For many, this signals a bullish market where prices are rising, and optimism abounds. It can indeed present opportunities for those looking to capitalize on upward momentum. However, it’s crucial to approach this period with a balanced perspective, recognizing both the potential rewards and inherent risks. Opportunities in a ‘Greed’ Market: Potential for Further Gains: When sentiment is strong, prices can continue to climb as more investors enter the market, driven by positive news and FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out). This can be a lucrative period for existing holders. Increased Liquidity: Higher trading volumes often accompany periods of greed, making it easier to buy and sell assets without significant price impact. This allows for smoother transactions and better execution of trades. Altcoin Season Potential: Sometimes, strong Bitcoin performance, which contributes to the index, can eventually spill over into altcoins, leading to broader market rallies. This can create diverse opportunities beyond just Bitcoin. Risks in a ‘Greed’ Market: Overvaluation: Periods of extreme greed can lead to assets becoming overvalued, creating bubbles that are unsustainable in the long run. This increases the risk of sharp price corrections. Increased Volatility: While greed can drive prices up, it can also lead to sharp corrections as sentiment can turn quickly. What goes up fast can come down even faster, catching unprepared investors off guard. FOMO-Driven Decisions: The psychological pressure to join a rising market can lead investors to make impulsive decisions, buying assets without proper research or at unsustainable prices. This is where the Crypto Fear & Greed Index acts as a warning sign against emotional trading. “Buy the Rumor, Sell the News”: Experienced traders often “sell into strength” when the market is overly optimistic, anticipating a price correction after major positive news is released. This strategy capitalizes on peak sentiment. Understanding these dynamics is key to using the Crypto Fear & Greed Index effectively. It’s not a buy or sell signal in itself, but rather a guide to the prevailing emotional climate, encouraging a thoughtful approach to investment decisions. Actionable Insights: What Does the Crypto Fear & Greed Index Tell Us? So, with the Crypto Fear & Greed Index currently at 72, what actionable steps can you consider? The index is a tool for strategic thinking, not impulsive action. Here are some insights to guide your approach: Exercise Caution, Not Panic: A high ‘Greed’ reading suggests the market might be due for a correction. This doesn’t mean sell everything immediately, but it does mean exercising increased caution. Re-evaluate your risk tolerance and ensure your portfolio aligns with your long-term goals. Avoid FOMO: Resist the urge to jump into assets purely because their prices are soaring. Do your own thorough research (DYOR) and understand the fundamentals of any asset before investing. The Crypto Fear & Greed Index helps you recognize when FOMO is rampant, prompting you to pause and think rationally. Consider Profit-Taking: If you’ve made significant gains, this might be a prudent time to take some profits off the table. Rebalancing your portfolio can help lock in gains and reduce exposure to potential downturns, protecting your capital. Develop a Strategy: Whether it’s Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA) or setting clear entry and exit points, having a pre-defined strategy helps you stick to your plan regardless of market sentiment. A well-defined strategy mitigates emotional trading. Long-Term vs. Short-Term: For long-term investors, short-term fluctuations in the Crypto Fear & Greed Index might be less critical. However, for short-term traders, it offers valuable insight into potential reversal points, aiding in timely decision-making. Diversify: Never put all your eggs in one basket. A diversified portfolio can help mitigate risks, especially during volatile periods that often follow periods of extreme greed. Spreading investments across different assets reduces overall risk. The Crypto Fear & Greed Index is a powerful indicator, but it’s just one piece of the puzzle. Combine its insights with technical analysis, fundamental research, and your personal financial goals for a robust investment strategy. Always remember that the crypto market is dynamic, and continuous learning is key to success. The recent surge of the Crypto Fear & Greed Index to 72, firmly embedding the market in the ‘Greed’ zone, is a clear signal of heightened optimism and investor enthusiasm. While this environment presents exciting opportunities for growth and potential gains, it also comes with inherent risks, primarily that of market overvaluation and subsequent corrections. By understanding the underlying components of the index—from volatility and market momentum to social media sentiment and Bitcoin dominance—investors can gain a deeper appreciation of the market’s psychological landscape. Ultimately, the index serves as a valuable cautionary tool, reminding us to temper enthusiasm with prudence, avoid FOMO-driven decisions, and rely on well-researched strategies rather than fleeting emotions. As the crypto market continues its dynamic journey, staying informed and emotionally disciplined remains paramount for navigating its exhilarating highs and challenging lows. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What does a high Crypto Fear & Greed Index score mean? A high score, typically above 50 and especially above 70, indicates that the market is experiencing “Greed.” This means investors are generally optimistic, prices are likely rising, and there’s a strong buying interest, often driven by the fear of missing out (FOMO). Is the Crypto Fear & Greed Index a buy or sell signal? No, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index is not a direct buy or sell signal. It’s an indicator of market sentiment. While extreme fear might suggest a buying opportunity (when others are fearful), and extreme greed might suggest a selling opportunity (when others are greedy), it should always be used in conjunction with other technical analysis, fundamental research, and your personal investment strategy. How often is the Crypto Fear & Greed Index updated? The Crypto Fear & Greed Index is updated daily by Alternative, reflecting the latest market data and sentiment shifts. Which factors influence the Crypto Fear & Greed Index the most? Volatility and Market Momentum/Volume each contribute 25% to the index’s score, making them the most heavily weighted factors. Social media and surveys (when active) contribute 15% each, while Bitcoin dominance and Google Trends each account for 10%. Can the Crypto Fear & Greed Index predict market crashes? While a very high “Greed” score on the Crypto Fear & Greed Index often precedes market corrections or crashes, it is not a precise predictor. It merely indicates that the market is becoming overbought and potentially due for a pullback. It’s a warning sign, not a definitive forecast. Why are surveys currently paused in the Crypto Fear & Greed Index calculation? The original source mentions that surveys are currently paused. The exact reasons for this pause are not always publicly disclosed by Alternative, the provider of the index. It could be due to data collection challenges, methodology review, or other operational considerations. Did this article help you understand the current market sentiment? Share these crucial insights with your network! Let’s help more people make informed decisions in the exciting world of crypto by sharing this article on your favorite social media platforms. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping market sentiment and investment strategies . This post Crypto Fear & Greed Index Soars to 72: Unveiling Market Optimism first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: MetaMask Bug Causes Excessive SSD Wear, Patch Promised Soon
body: MetaMask users have discovered a bug related to the browser wallet extension. In some cases, the plugin constantly overwrites gigabytes of data on SSDs. The developers have promised to fix the problem soon. Users of the MetaMask cryptocurrency wallet have complained that the extension writes gigabytes of data to their solid-state drives (SSDs), putting them at risk of failure. The developers said they are aware of the bug and plan to fix it, according to media reports. The issue gained increased attention after a user with the nickname ripper31337 opened a relevant ticket in a repository on GitHub. He stated that the extension writes up to 500 GB per day. The bug affects browsers based on the Chromium engine, including Google Chrome and Opera. The data is written to the Local Extension Settings folder, particularly in files such as 011717.log, 011719.ldb, and MANIFEST-000001. Constant overwriting of data at a rate of 5 MB/s may lead to failure of the SSD, which is not designed for such a load. In comments on the ticket, users said that the problem appeared about a month ago. However, user Michael S reported the issue as early as March 2025. Some commenters have already noticed computer slowdowns and other difficulties due to the bug. It is known that the extension starts recording data as soon as the browser is activated. It is not necessary to run the plugin directly for this to happen. The only currently proven way to address the problem is to remove the wallet extension. In a comment to the press, a spokesperson for Consensys, the developer of MetaMask, said the firm is aware of the problem. However, he stated that the bug only affects a small number of users. ”While browser extension wallets do regularly write state to disk, which is expected behavior, we’ve taken note of a recent observation shared by a small number of MetaMask users who reported unusually high disk activity,” he said. According to published reports, a fix for this bug will be released in the near future, though no specific date has been given. In particular, the developers are considering reducing the size of each record and lowering the frequency of data writes.
